greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{n>=1} 1/(3^n-1).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: Equals Sum_{k>=1} d(k)/3^k, where d(k) is the number of divisors of k (A000005). - _Amiram Eldar_, May 17 2020
mathematica: RealDigits[ NSum[1/(3^n - 1), {n, 1, Infinity}, WorkingPrecision -> 110, NSumTerms -> 100], 10, 105] // First (* or *) 1 - (Log[2] + QPolyGamma[0, 1, 1/3])/Log[3] // RealDigits[#, 10, 105]& // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 05 2013 *)
x = 1/3; RealDigits[ Sum[ DivisorSigma[0, k] x^k, {k, 1000}], 10, 105][[1]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Oct 12 2014 after an observation and the formula of _Amarnath Murthy_, see A073668 *)
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 14 2012
